title: Excessive Spring Data build logging after Spring bump to 3.2

labels.name: area/spring
labels.description: Issues relating to the Spring integration

body:
### Describe the bug

After https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/40344 I can see a lot of information in logs I really don't care about us user. It's just my personal opinion, but logging level feels wrong.

### Expected behavior

Personally I'd use DEBUG log level or lower.

### Actual behavior

Many log message I do not plan to read

```
[INFO] [io.quarkus.spring.data.rest.deployment.RepositoryMethodsImplementor] Method code: MethodDescriptor{name='list', returnType='Ljava/util/List;', parameterTypes=[Lio/quarkus/panache/common/Page;, Lio/quarkus/panache/common/Sort;, Ljava/lang/String;, Ljava/util/Map;]}

```

### How to Reproduce?

1. `git clone git@github.com:michalvavrik/quarkus-test-suite.git -b feature/fix-spring-data-compilation`
2. `cd quarkus-test-suite/spring/spring-data`
3. `mvn clean verify -Dit.test=SecuredRepositoryRestResourcesIT#publicResourceNoAut -Dreruns=0`

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Fedora 38

### Output of `java -version`

OpenJDK 21

### Quarkus version or git rev

999-SNAPSHOT

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.4

_No response_
